item.title: Ricardo Villalobos - NDRA (Reissue)
item.description: Label: Rawax Germany | Prix: 16,00 € | Style: Minimal House , Techno
item.content:encoded:
Label: Rawax Germany

Prix: 16,00 €

Style: Minimal House , Techno

Rawax continues to explore the rich, deep and undeniably wonky back catalogue of Chilean minimal master Ricardo Villalobos. This time round, they've opted to reissue something truly historic: the Berlin-based wonk-king's in-demand 1996 debut, the 'N-Dra' EP. The A-side title track is far more forthright than his later productions, but still runs to nearly 13 minutes and combines restless techno kick-drums with flashes of South American percussion, oddball vocal samples, and plenty of lost-in-the-groove effects trickery - as well as a deliciously dirty, stabbing bassline. He doffs a cap to Playhouse - a label he'd later release on - via the late-night throb-and-jack of 'Say That You Love Me', which features great interplay between his dirty electronic bassline and looped classic house vocal snippets, while 'Trockenteile' is pleasingly scuzzy, dark and wayward.

Tracklist:

  • A1. N DRA
  • B1. Say That You Love Me
  • B2. Trockenteile

item.title: Doc L Junior - Footnotes 3 (2025 Remastered)
item.description: Label: All That Jelly | Prix: 18,00 € | Style: House
item.content:encoded:
Label: All That Jelly

Prix: 18,00 €

Style: House

This record is like the lost crown jewels of House Music with a story that spans decades. Originally programmed in 1998 on an Akai S3000XL, this was meant to be released on Bjørn Torske's Footnotes in 2001. Unfortunately the original matrix and the master DAT tapes got lost under crazy circumstances. Yet several years later the tapes were found by Sex Tags Mania in the studio of mastering engineer Helmut Erler and the record eventually got issued in 2009 when a totally different House sound was "en vogue." Then due to some unfortunate coincidences most of the records ended up in far flung Japan, and so this record stayed totally underground. Yet it became a cult hit when House Music and later Disco got a proper revival around 2010/11. So over the years prices for this rarity were rising and rising... Then fast forward to 2025: after a sunny day off Berlin's modular synthesizer show "Superbooth" ATJ boss Mr. Fonk and Doc L. Junior teamed up to finally reissue this gem with new masters by Andreas Kauffelt of "Schnittstelle" / Berlin. On this 12“ Norwegian Disco and Balearic sounds meet: funky but deep to the core, playful but hypnotic, stripped down but with baroque details. Truly one of House Music's greatest productions.

Tracklist:

  • A1. You Do Know How To Dance
  • B1. Baracuda

item.title: St David - The Freakshow EP
item.description: Label: Chiwax | Prix: 15,00 € | Style: House , Deep House
item.content:encoded:
Label: Chiwax

Prix: 15,00 €

Style: House , Deep House

Bari-born Davide Disanto, better known as St. David, has carved a name for himself by reviving the punchy, groove-forward energy of 90s US house. Active on wax for over a decade, his records, steeped in MPC grit and garage swing, have gone on to demolish global vinyl charts and landed in sets from the likes of The Martinez Brothers, Jovonn, Chris Stussy and Riva Starr. Now through acid tacits Chiwax does his next EP emerge; a travelling four-track 'Freakshow' of well wrangled proportions, the most freakish of all being the gnarly, choppy 'On A Freaky Style' and the even wilder 'I Am Ready'.

Tracklist:

  • A1. Bring The Beat Back
  • A2. On A Freaky Style
  • B1. Rock Da Discotech
  • B2. I Am Ready

item.title: Moodymann - Forevernevermore ( Obi Series )
item.description: Label: Peacefrog | Prix: 55,00 € | Style: House, Deep House , Detroit House
item.content:encoded:
Label: Peacefrog

Prix: 55,00 €

Style: House, Deep House , Detroit House

Moodymann classic Forevernevermore gets a reissue on OG label Peacefrog and it's unquestionably a record that belongs in the collection of any and all fans of KDJ. Originally released back in 2000, the music has lost none of its freshness, brimming with raw funk and Motor City swagger. Blending cavalier sampling and agile instrumentation, the music darts through disco-infused hedonism, spoken-word mantras and blasts of soulful euphoria. Standouts are the timeless 'Don't You Want My Love', the gospel depth of 'The Thief That Stole My Sad Days', and the powerfully evocative title track. Must own, simple as that.

Tracklist:

  • A1.Meanwhile Back At Home
  • A2. Wednesday Night People
  • A3. The Set Up
  • B1. (Logo)
  • B2. Don't You Want My Love
  • C1. Your Sweet Lovin
  • C2. The Thief That Stole My Sad Days (Ya Blessin Me)
  • D1. Tribute
  • D2. Forevernevermore

item.title: Moodymann - Black Mahogani ( Obi series ) 3 vinyls
item.description: Label: Peacefrog | Prix: 65,00 € | Style: Deep House , Detroit House
item.content:encoded:
Label: Peacefrog

Prix: 65,00 €

Style: Deep House , Detroit House

Over 20 years since its first release, Moodymann's Black Mahogani remains a landmark in deep house and Black American music. Originally issued in 2004, it's a richly atmospheric album that blends deep house, soul, jazz and cinematic textures into a singular Detroit statement. Drawing on earlier KDJ 12" releases, Kenny Dixon Jr. expands his palette with live contributions from Detroit legends like Amp Fiddler, Roberta Sweed and Norma Jean Bell. The result is a warm, analogue masterpiece full of emotional depth and tension, a timeless work that honours 1970s soul while reshaping electronic music with raw, organic elegance.

Tracklist:

  • A1.Holiday
  • A2. Roberta Jean Machine
  • B1. I Need You So Much
  • B2. Runaway
  • C1. I'm Doing Fine
  • D1. Shades Of Jae
  • D2. Riley's Song
  • D3. Back At Bakers (On Livernois)
  • E1. Mahogani 9000
  • F1. Black Mahogani

item.title: Elizio De Buzios - Tamanqueiro
item.description: Label: New Dawn | Prix: 16,00 € | Style: Funk , Brasil
item.content:encoded:
Label: New Dawn

Prix: 16,00 €

Style: Funk , Brasil

Crate diggers and rare groove enthusiasts have long been fans of Elizio de Buzos' sole single, 'Tamanqueiro' - so much so, in fact, that the track has frequently been described as "the best Jorge Ben record that Jorge Ben never made". The record has long been tricky to find, hence this much-needed reissue on the Rush Hour-affiliated New Dawn label. The title track, which means 'clogmaker' in Portuguese, is an effortlessly funky fusion of jangling samba guitars, fast-fingered jazz-funk bass guitar, unfussy MPB drums and effervescent vocals from de Buzos. Over on the flip you'll find original B-side 'Sau Um Loco', an emotional, downtempo samba-soul number rich in luscious orchestration, twinkling electric piano and wide-eyed female backing vocals.

Tracklist:

  • A1.Tamanqueiro
  • A2. Sou Um Louco

item.title: Glenn Underground - Grass Root
item.description: Label: Strictly Jaz Unit Muzic | Prix: 35,00 € | Style: House , Deep House
item.content:encoded:
Label: Strictly Jaz Unit Muzic

Prix: 35,00 €

Style: House , Deep House

Chicago house guardian and Windy City legend in his own right, Glenn Underground is back with a long overdue follow-up to his previous Tech House LP all the way back in 1996 on Peacefrog. It finds him delivering eight tracks of pure, rooted rhythm designed to ignite the dancefloor and speak to your soul. From thumping kicks to crispy hi-hats and punchy deep bass, each track is covered with his sonic fingerprint and a masterful balance of emotional content and relentless drive. Subtly recalling the legacy of dons like Heard, Knuckles and Hardy, this is house music perfected over decades.

Tracklist:

  • A1. Grass Root (I Control Your Pleasure)
  • A2. Transparent Streets
  • B1. Bending & Streching
  • B2. Mama's House (Homan & Harrison mix)
  • C1. Flight Zone
  • C2. Jack Magnanimous
  • D1. Dance R
  • D2. Eli Opus Omnis (main)

item.title: Daniel Wang - Aphroasia Technubian (Remastered)
item.description: Label: Balihu | Prix: 18,00 € | Style: Disco , Nu Disco
item.content:encoded:
Label: Balihu

Prix: 18,00 €

Style: Disco , Nu Disco

Just over 30 years after it first started appearing in New York record stores, one of Daniel Wang's most beloved early EPs gets a remastered reissue. Created at a point when he was still learning his craft as a producer (he owned little more than a sampler and a couple of basic synths), the six tracks combined his deep-rooted love of disco culture with nods to the tactile deep house warmth of Pal Joey, the Burrell Brothers, and the organ-rich garage-house sounds of New Jersey dons the Basement Boys. Deep, sample-rich, tactile, melodious and evocative, some of its synth-heavy tracks sound like blueprints for what became the nu-disco sound of fellow New York residents Metro Area. More than that, it remains a genuinely brilliant six-track missive that has undoubtedly stood the test of time.

Tracklist:

  • A1.Unhouse
  • A2. The Twirl
  • A3. Loose Vibes
  • B1. E Village Hustle
  • B2. Not Feeling It
  • B3. In The Street

item.title: Tim Maia - Disco Club
item.description: Label: Mr Bongo | Prix: 34,00 €
item.content:encoded:
Label: Mr Bongo

Prix: 34,00 €

Mr Bongo brings another Brazilian rarity to the masses with this sublime reissue of Tim Maia's Disco Club. Recorded in 1978, it's a latter-period gem from the larger than life legend, combining the glitz and glamour of disco's heyday with Maia's raw funk and soul roots.When Maia first heard Little Richard as a teenager, he knew what kind of singer and artist he wanted to be. Five formative years spent in the US, where he ran wild in NYC and joined adoo-wop group called the Ideals, did little to dampen his enthusiasm for black music.Stirred by the civil rights movement in the US and driven by a punk spirit, Maia went on to blaze his own trail through the early 70s over the course of four successful albums for Polydor. Moving away from the straight MPB, Tropicalia and international rock dominating the airwaves, his sound represented a new black Brazilian consciousness. When he sang, he could be raspy and defiant one moment ... and then romantic and reflective the next. But always on a groove and with a hook. It was an irresistible combination.Yet by 1977 he was bankrupt and in limbo having first joined a religious cult called Superior National and then alienated listeners with his first album sung entirely in English. To complicate matters further, Brazil was feeling the Saturday Night Fever. Gloria Gaynor, Chic and Kool & the Gang were dominating the charts and filling hotspots such as New York City Discotheque in Ipanema and Frenetic Dancing Days in the Gávea Mall.Maia left his usual band and went into the legendary Estudios Level with a mighty ensemble of Rio's finest including Paulinha Braga on drums, Jamil Joanes on bass, Robson Jorge on clarinet, Hyldon De Souza on guitar, Sidinho on percussion, trombonists Edmundo Maciel and Darcy Seixas, and Juarez Assis on tenor sax.Arranger and keyboardist Lincoln Olivetti was a crucial presence during these sessions. He added that all-important string flourish and brassy joy to the uptempo tracks while giving thestar enough room to express himself. The album kicks off with a trio of floor fillers: the exuberant party starter 'A Fim De Voltar', a sing-a-long anthem in 'Acenda O Farol' and the undeniably funky hit 'Sossego' (file that one next to Fatback).But then Maia drops it down and gets existential on 'All I Want', questioning the meaning of happiness. He also shows his tender side on slow burners such as 'Murmúrio' (written by the great Cassiano) and 'Pais E Filhos', the latter featuring a supersoft bed of harmonies you can't help but lay down on. But the party ain't over and mid-tempo groover 'Juras' gets the feet moving again before 'Jhony' sends us swaying off into the night.Maia's appetite for excess would eventually get the better of him. But Disco Club is the sound of an unpredictable genius on top form. Get ready for the time of your life.

Tracklist:

  • A1.A Fim De Voltar
  • A2.Acenda O Farol
  • A3.Sossego
  • A4.Vitoria Regia Estou Contigo E Nao Abro
  • A5.All I Want
  • B1.Murmurio
  • B2.Pais E Filhos
  • B3.Se Me Lembro Faz Doer
  • B4.Juras
  • B5.Jhony

item.title: Aleqs Notal - Behind The Noise
item.description: Label: Industrial Light | Prix: 14,00 € | Style: House, Dub House
item.content:encoded:
Label: Industrial Light

Prix: 14,00 €

Style: House, Dub House

“Behind the Noise“ marks a powerful new chapter in Aleqs Notal’s musical journey.It's a declaration, a rupture and a surge of heat aimed straight at the dance floor and the soul, engineered to move thebodies and the foundations.The E.P. includes 4 tracks sculpted with a cutting-edge groove that fuses the weight of dub, the propulsion of DetroitTechno, and the warmth of House Music into one timeless movement.In an era drowning in gloss and shallow repetition, "Behind the Noise" rises as a manifesto for honesty, for the craft andfor music that dares to makes you feel and meditate.Through his music, Notal is urging us to listen deeper, to move with clarity, and to remember what lies beneath thesurface.Behind the Noise, there is truth..and it hits hard!

Tracklist:

  • A1.Indistinct Chatter
  • A2.Heartproof
  • B1.Am I Dreamin
  • B2.Behind The Noise

item.content:encoded:

NES label founder and Danish DJ Popup brings his signature deep house sensibilities to the Aurore 404 imprint. The release features three house cuts that showcase his dual love for groove-driven, Daft Punk–influenced rhythms and deeper, more hypnotic shades of deep house. DJ Central steps in on remix duties, rounding out a true Regelbau family affair.

item.title: François Kevorkian, Dimitri From Paris - The Nassau Excursion
item.description: Label: Rush Hour | Prix: 16,00 € | Style: Boogie , House, Dub
item.content:encoded:
Label: Rush Hour

Prix: 16,00 €

Style: Boogie , House, Dub

House MasterpieceSome 30 years after they first met in the DJ booth of Tokyo’s Spacelab Yellow nightclub, close friends François Kevorkian and Dimitri From Paris have finally joined forces in the studio. The result is The Nassau Excursion, a dazzlingly good three-track EP inspired by their joint love of disco and boogie-era dance records made at Island Records’ Compass Point Studio in the Bahamas. Across three essential tracks, François and Dimitri explore and celebrate this distinctive Caribbean post-disco sound – one where weighty basslines and heavy drum machine beats rub shoulders with early ‘80s synths, dub-style production, heady hand percussion patterns and arrangements drenched in space echo and tape delay.[info sheet from distr.]

Tracklist:

  • A. The Compass Point
  • B1. 2 Da Riddim
  • B2. Steppers Revenge
